author: Liqwid Labs
title: Haskell DeFi SDK for Plutus Devs
description: Cardano DeFi developers need an open-source standardized method for querying several DeFi protocols in parallel to build composable L2 dApps

assessments.note: As a DeFi developer with some Haskell and FP experience looking to get into Cardano development this would be a helpful resource.
This idea seems to align well with the dev ecosystem challenge, a DeFi SDK for Plutus developers to query balances in one place is a great idea.
The Liqwid team has deep Haskell experience and they link open source Haskell project repos in the proposal body.

The proposal effectively details the benefit of its implementation in the Defi/Dapp developments in the Cardano blockchain. The key metrics and plan are well established and the funds allocated with transparency.
We need more open source tooling for dev and app users to standardize how they engage in DeFi protocols. This is a feature that can sepaarate cardano defi from ethereum.
Complete in references, scope, examples, info, road map and measurements against kpi's, metrics
DeFi and NFT should be the high priority area for the ecosystem and having SDK for DeFi is the need of the hour.
DeFi protocols will generate value on Cardano. We must make sure the open source tooling/composability across DeFi protocols is built in Plutus
The team has presented several open source Haskell repos highlighting previous experience building open source dev tools
The proposal team has included sufficient information in their proposal to show their Haskell open source and fintech domain expertise.

The proposer provides sufficient links to fully review the MLabs Haskell work, in addition this proposal has the potential to drive Cardano DeFi to rapidly innovate on top of the incumbent Ethereum status quo.
The proposal includes a detailed project plan, development roadmap and again highlighting their teams senior Haskell experience.

There is high expertise in the development side of it and the passion to make it easier and open source for upcoming project developers to build in the network. The plan has a scheduled pattern where the community can track the progress. This promotes confidence in the successful return for the community.
The proposal includes a lot of information on their Haskell open source work and team's previous experience.
Evaluating by track record, detail plan, and the importance of this plutus defi sdk for developers its clearly a must for successful guegen implementation
Dewayne is well known in the community for his productive actions. have no doubts that the proposal will be implemented  successfully.
After reviewing the MLabs team, this proposal has the potential to help push Cardano DeFi to innovate over the Ethereum model.
The Haskell devs behind this proposal have a ton of open source project experience.
This proposal includes a lot of valuable information for reviewers. The team experience is clear
The proposal is consistent with the challenge and describes a new type of DeFi SDK for standardizing account management.
The proposal provides sufficient information to believe in the successful implementation of this DeFi SDK for Plutus developers.
This proposal could simplify/standardize how Cardano devs interact with multiple DeFi protocols from a single contract call.

The proposal provide the adequate information of what is needed to get there, the funding used, the work of experienced developers and the roadmap to deploy the solution. Although for the voters a more clear explanation and praphical representation should make it easier how this improves that system from the point of view of individuals who do not know much about the development and how these implementations assist the process of Dapp/Defi projects into Cardano in the future.
The senior Haskell experience working with the Liqwid team and gameplan predict chances of successful implementation are strong.

Proposal look like a project management textbook example, can see no detail left out, no uncertainty, easy understandable. Will lead to developers to built efficient aggregator protocols that can quickly at low cost query the state of a user's assets and debts across several defi protocols in a unified model, as the proposal state

proposal provides a lot of information about the deliverables and feasibility. only one problem i have is that i feel amounted budget is little too high for team of 6 developers for work of 3-5 months.
This proposal if implemented successfully will drive Cardano's DeFi developer ecosystem.
The team behind this proposal shows a strong grasp of the DeFi protocol design space, open source dev tooling must match the protocol development.
Complete proposal with a fund2 community-backed team behind it.

solution: Plutus DeFi SDK is an open-source set of smart contracts designed for DeFi portfolio accounting; the on-chain balanceOf for DeFi protocols.
